results.title: Tarzan (Disney)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Bonnie Arnold, Kevin Lima and Chris Buck
results.brief_description: Disney brings Edgar Rice Burroughs’ story ‘Tarzan’ to life in this full length animated film. Tarzan is a baby boy, adopted by a gorilla named Kala, following the death of her own child. She brings him into the group against the wishes of their leader, a large silverback gorilla named Kerchak. Tarzan quickly makes friends with a gorilla named Terk, and an elephant named Tantor despite his obvious differences. Tarzan grows up believing he is one of the gorillas - until he meets Jane. This event changes Tarzan’s life as he learns about who and what he really is. Featuring five songs written and performed by Phil Collins including the Oscar winning song “You’ll be in my heart”, and the voices of Glenn Close, Rosie O’Donnell, Minnie Driver, Wayne Knight, Nigel Hawthorne and Alex D. Linz as the voice of young Tarzan.

holdings.name: MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI Digital Access Copy - overscan

results.title: Tarot: strictly supernatural
results.creator_credit: Non Fiction Films, Andre Singer, Ludo Graham and Justin Hardy
results.brief_description: An informative look at tarot cards and tarot card reading, centering around the mysterious origins of the cards themselves, and the way their meanings and usage have changed over the centuries. Tarot card readers, historians, and parapsychologists discuss the appeal of the tarot, and offer anecdotes and theories as to why people are so drawn to this ancient craft. Also explores the symbolism behind the artwork, the different spreads that can be used in a reading, and the meanings of the major and minor arcana. Narrated by Christopher Lee.

results.title: Taronga
results.creator_credit: Taronga Zoological Park Trust and Lawrence Collings
results.brief_description: Taronga, which is an aboriginal name for beautiful view, is the home of the extensive collection of animals and birds of the Zoological Trust on the North Shore of Sydney Harbour. The film follows a party of children on their tour of the grounds and shows koalas, emus, kangaroos and Australian birds as well as the larger animals from overseas. Amusements available to the children include being allowed to hold and feed baby animals in the nursery and to go for rides on elephants and miniature trains.

results.title: Tarnished angels [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Albert Zugsmith and Douglas Sirk
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Pylon” by William Faulkner, this powerful drama, set in New Orleans at the Mardi Gras’ aerial circus in 1932, revolves around a disenchanted trio of air circus daredevils. The story is about failure, a glimpse of the twilight world of ‘flying gypsies’ through the eyes of an alcoholic newspaperman. Faulkner’s style is necessarily transmuted not so much by an undeniable gloss and glamour brought to the playing out of tortured relationships, as by an unsurpassed density of visual expression and atmosphere. In linking festivity and death, Sirk finds correlatives for entrapment: circular motion and symbols of circularity, alternating areas of darkness and light, the clutter of objects and the unconventional ordering of shots. Cast includes Rock Hudson, Robert Stack, Dorothy Malone, Jack Carson, Robert Middleton.

results.title: Tarkine: the forgotten wilderness
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Warth
results.brief_description: In the north-west of Tasmania is one of the largest areas of temperate wilderness left on earth, the Tarkine. This documentary looks at the region, the flora and fauna, pristine rivers, landscapes and ecology including excellent footage of Tasmanian devils, quolls, echidnas, platypus etc in their natural habitats and gigantic Huon pines which are over 3,000 years old. However, change could be on the way - the Tarkine area is being surveyed for its commercial worth and with only a small part of the Tarkine coming under the Parks and Wildlife protection, this ruggedly beautiful and isolated piece of wilderness could be under threat. Narrated by Michael Balson.

results.title: Tarka the otter
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions and David Cobham
results.brief_description: Adapted from Henry Williamson’s 1927 novel. Traces the life of Tarka from birth through a series of adventures until its eventual confrontation with humans. Narrated by Peter Ustinov.

results.title: Target for tonight
results.creator_credit: Crown Film Unit and Harry Watt
results.brief_description: A dramatic reconstruction of a bombing raid by Britain’s Royal Air Force on a German base in 1941. Covers the preliminary planning beginning with aerial photographic reconnaissance of the objective, preparations and the attack itself.

results.title: Tara's mulch garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and Jon Pedersen
results.brief_description: This is a simple, poetic film about mulching. Tara Callaghan explains the principle of her garden, takes us through the different growing phases, and leaves us with a splendid harvest of healthy vegetables.
